channel.title: Delta, commands

item.title: Delta, commands
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

if (!playerHasItem(ID_OF_MONEY, AMOUNT_OF_MONEY))
{
sM(“You don’t have xxxx amount of money in order to do this.”);
return;
}

Add that after: “if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“alch”)){”

Note, the playerHasItem method might be called hasItem, I’m not sure. Try it yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Delta, commands
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

[quote=“PIEBAR2FAR, post:1, topic:435689”]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“alch”)){
addItem(561, 1000);
addItem(554, 5000);
deleteItem(995, 5060000);
} else {
sM (“you need 5m and 60k to use this command”);
}
as of now, thats what my command looks like, it does not require and money to use, how would i make it so you can only use it if you have the required amount of money?[/quote]
if(command.startsWith(“alch”)) {
addItem(561, 1000);
addItem(554, 5000);
deleteItem(995, 5060000);
} else {
sM (“you need 5m and 60k to use this command”);
}

You need to add a statement that checks if it has the money.
